    • Inbuilt Color Schemes

    Elixon Tooltip by default supports following color schemes: dark, yellow, blue, sand, green, red

    You can select the color scheme by passing the name of the scheme to color parameter when calling the Elixon Tooltip: $('#myElement').et({color: "blue"});

    You can optionally set the color scheme as default for all tooltips: $.fn.et('defaults', {color: "blue"});

    Custom Color Schemes

    If you want to create color variants only then use this CSS template for a start. Replace the ColorName, BgColor, BorderColor, TextColor strings with your own values. 

    .et.ColorName { opacity: 0.9; background-color: BgColor; border-color: BorderColor; color: TextColor; }
.et.ColorName a {color: TextColor;}
.et.ColorName:before { border-color: BorderColor transparent; }
.et.ColorName:after {border-color: BgColor transparent; }
.et.ColorName.etLeft:before, .et.ColorName.etRight:before { border-color: transparent BorderColor; }
.et.ColorName.etLeft:after, .et.ColorName.etRight:after {border-color: transparent BgColor; }

    Variable meanings

    • ColorName - CSS class name that will be added to the outer bubble's div element.
    • BgColor - Background color of the tooltip.
    • BorderColor - Border color of the tooltip.
    • TextColor - Foreground text of the tooltip.

    Then you can call the Elixon Tooltip and pass the ColorName name as the color parameter.

    $('#myElement').et({color: "ColorName"});

    Or you can set the default color scheme as default before calling any tooltip.

    $.fn.et('defaults', {color: "ColorName"});

    Full Example

    <link type="text/css" rel="stylesheet" href="./jquery.tooltip.css" />
<script type="text/javascript" src="./jquery-1.6.2.min.js"></script>
<script type="text/javascript" src="./jquery.tooltip.js"></script>
<style type="text/css">
  .et.myColor { opacity: 0.9; background-color: #FFFF6B; border-color: #959500; color: black; }
  .et.myColor a {color: blue;}
  .et.myColor:before { border-color: #959500 transparent; }
  .et.myColor:after {border-color: #FFFF6B transparent; }
  .et.myColor.etLeft:before, .et.myColor.etRight:before { border-color: transparent #959500; }
  .et.myColor.etLeft:after, .et.myColor.etRight:after {border-color: transparent #FFFF6B; }
</style>
<script type="text/javascript">
  $.fn.et('defaults', {color: "myColor"}); // Set it as default
  $('#something').et(); // Normal Elixon Tooltip usage
</script>
